p: Although trade and travel played a role in the introduction and subsequent dispersion of the vector, climate change is also believed to have been a factor, despite that its relative contribution is uncertain (Caminade et al. 2012). Warm seasonal and annual temperatures and ample rainfall in Europe offer conducive climatic conditions for A. albopictus (Roiz et al. 2011). The introduction and geographical expansion of the vector has coincided with favourable climatic conditions in France, the Balkans, the eastern coasts of Spain and the Adriatic Sea, and the Benelux countries and western Germany (Caminade et al. 2012). However, some other parts of Europe that have not yet observed the presence and establishment of the vector are climatically suitable for A. albopictus (Fig. 3; Rogers, Suk and Semenza 2014; Proestos et al. 2015).
